alert.note: Alert for Missoula, Bitterroot Valleys (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 10 at 6:33PM MST until January 12 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM TO 5 PM MST THURSDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Snow coverage increases during Thursday morning becoming periods of moderate snow during the afternoon with accumulations of 1 to 3 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Flash freeze possible. Total snow accumulations between 2 and 4 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. The combination of snow, wind, and cold temperatures make this a potentially dangerous situation for people and animals. * WHERE...Missoula and Bitterroot Valley. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 5 AM to 5 PM MST Thursday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Thursday afternoon through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be affected. Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the Thursday morning and evening commutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
